issues.description: Constructor signature of Meal in template does not match the problem specification. The UML and usage examples expect Meal(String name, String[] ingredients), but the template declares Meal(String[] ingredients, String name). This will prevent students from following the intended design and from compiling the example code.
issues.suggested_fix: In src/de/tum/cit/ase/Meal.java, change the constructor signature to public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients) so that the first parameter is the meal name and the second parameter is the ingredients array, matching the UML and usage examples.

issues.description: The Meal constructor’s parameter order in the template (String[] ingredients, String name) conflicts with the problem statement and solution which define it as Meal(String name, String[] ingredients). This inversion makes it unclear to students how to instantiate Meal as described in the exercise.
issues.suggested_fix: Swap the parameter order in the template’s Meal constructor to match the specified signature: public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients). Ensure all references (including example calls in Main) use the same ordering.
